column4: Bump - is there anything I can do to improve Google Earth performance on my laptop (intel graph card), compiz/metacity about equally bad), or should I just scrap it?
disable "atmosphere", it kills performance on Intel graphics cards
but there is still the problem that the image field overlays other windows and menus...  Wrong settings somehow?
I don't know about that. generally I've found that stuff that uses OpenGL won't play nicely along compiz.
yeah me too - but seems to be the same problem with plain Metacity

BTW I don't know if this is still true, but one year ago compiz did set the environment variable LIBGL_ALWAYS_INDIRECT to true, thereby preventing opengl stuff from drawing directly, which has a significant performance impact at least on Intel cards
I'm not sure using plain metacity will prevent compiz from running. I just switched to openbox and have been happy since.
check whether LIBGL_ALWAYS_INDIRECT is set
where do I check this?
in any terminal emulator inside the same session. launch a terminal and then echo $LIBGL_ALWAYS_INDIRECT
by using metacity --replace, I should be pretty  sure compiz isn't  running - or  what?
I don't know
thanks
echo $LIBGL_ALWAYS_INDIRECT gives an empty reply
so now compiz shouldn't be running
that is strange. Compiz is running but echo $LIBGL_ALWAYS_INDIRECT gives empty line as reply
I tried enabling openBox and you're right, Google Earth runs much, much better here
still would like to be able to use one window manager though...
I'm sure you can achieve the same performance with metacity disabling the compiz decorator, but I haven't looked into a way to accomplish this since I've always liked openbox better anyway
sure... I'll try some more...
and what is true for google earth also hold true for other major productivity software like... darkplaces or other FPSs :-)
haha, I believe you - I'm not much of a gamer though
